column2: We are looking for an expert Scrum Master (IDC) to facilitate an agile team working under the scrum methodology. The ideal candidate will serve as a point person responsible for understanding the big development picture of each sprint. This role is responsible for delegating tasks appropriately and ensuring the team is working on the right tasks at the right time, keeping the team fully deployed and not idle.       Responsibilities         Scrum Master for multiple Scrum Teams.         Help build a productive environment where team members own the product and enjoy working on it.         Guiding teams on how to use Agile, Scrum, SAFe, Kanban practices and values to meet deliverables.         Guiding team to self-organize and to fill in the intentional gaps left in the Agile/Scrum frameworks.         Assisting with internal and external communication, improving transparency, radiating information with the help of dashboards and metrics at different levels.         Proactively define and implement communications mechanisms that meet the needs of individual team members and project stakeholders at all levels.         Be the point of contact for external communications (stakeholders)         Work with the team to help identify risks and/or issues. Drive mitigation planning by collaborating with key team members, with escalation and reporting as appropriate.         Assessing the Scrum Maturity of teams and enact plans to lead the team to higher levels of maturity.         Provide leadership, direction and coaching to an agile team by encouraging them to adopt and mature good scrum processes.         Own the Sprint/Scrum backlog and Ensure deliverables are up to quality standards at the end of each sprint.         Supporting and educating the Product Manager, Product Owner and other stakeholders, especially with respect to reviewing and maintaining the product backlog.         Resolve conflicts and remove obstacles that occurs at Team Program Levels         Foster a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear, with an emphasis on problem-solving and self-improvement.         Build a high-performing team Focus on ever-improving team dynamics and performance.         Qualifications          At least 2 years of hands on experience as a Scrum Master for a development team.         6+ years of IT industry experience preferably in a Development/Dev-Ops environment         Expected to handle multiple Scrum Teams         Facilitates core Scrum ceremonies and activities (e.g. Daily Standups, Sprint Planning, Sprint Retrospectives)         Ensures that all team members and stakeholders are always up-to-speed         Reports, Tracks and produces key metrics (e.g., burn-down charts, velocity etc)         Improves the teams engineering practices and tools as needed: You make sure teams have the tools and know-how they need to succeed through coaching, training etc.         Resolves organization impediments and deflect external interruptions during sprints         Bachelor s degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science/Engineering         First level Scrum Master certification i.e. Professional Scrum Master PSM I or Certified Scrum Master CSM         Deep Knowledge of agile methodology and frameworks (i.e., Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, XP, etc.)         Good communication and presentation skills in English and a self-starter         Skills          Familiarity with SaaS deployments and its supporting architecture         Utilizes tools such as Visual Studio Team Services, Jira and its supporting extensions for required views, data, dashboards and reports.         Advanced Scrum Master Certification level 2 is a plus         Good understanding of project management principles         Knowledge of any south Indian language (i.e. Tamil, Telegu, Malayam, kannada) a plus         Knowledge of Requirement Engineering and Management in terms of collection, analysis, documentation and tracing.
column11: Software design, Agile scrum, Project management, Scrum, Agile methodology, Visual Studio, Customer service, PSM, JIRA

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for PySpark Professional to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey               Apache Spark Fundamentals    : You have a solid understanding of the Apache Spark architecture, its components like Spark Core, Spark SQL, Spark Streaming, MLlib, and Spark GraphX.            Python Programming    : You are proficient in Python programming language as PySpark heavily relies on Python APIs for data manipulation, analysis, and processing.            Data Manipulation and Analysis    : You are experienced in performing data manipulation tasks such as filtering, transforming, aggregating, and joining large datasets using PySpark DataFrame API or RDDs (Resilient Distributed Datasets).            Spark SQL    : You can write SQL queries using Spark SQL for querying structured data and performing analytics operations on DataFrames and tables.            Data Processing Pipelines    : You are capable of designing and building end-to-end data processing pipelines using PySpark that can handle various stages of data ingestion, cleaning, transformation, and analysis.            Performance Optimization    : You have knowledge of techniques for optimizing PySpark jobs and improving the performance of Spark applications, including partitioning, caching, and tuning the execution settings.            Integration with External Systems    : You can integrate PySpark with various data sources and file formats such as HDFS, S3, Hive, Parquet, Avro, JSON, CSV, etc.              Key Skills    :- React JS

column1: Scrum Master-Ecom / PIM / CMS / GTM / DS
column2: We are seeking an experienced Scrum Master with a focus on E-commerce, PIM, CMS, GTM, and DS to join our team       As a Scrum Master, you will be responsible for leading Agile projects, facilitating Agile ceremonies, and ensuring the team delivers high-quality products that meet business objectives            Responsibilities:                Coach the development team and stakeholders on Agile principles, values, and practices          Facilitate Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives          Ensure the team is following the Agile framework and adapting it to fit their needs          Collaborate with the Product Owner to define and prioritize the product backlog          Manage and remove any impediments that are blocking the teams progress          Help the team to continuously improve their performance and optimize their processes          Communicate progress and status to stakeholders and leadership              Requirements:              Strong understanding of Agile methodologies, frameworks, and practices          Experience working with E-commerce, PIM, CMS, GTM, and DS          Excellent communication, facilitation, and leadership skills          Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams          Experience leading multiple Agile projects simultaneously              Qualifications:              Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field          Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalent Agile certification preferred          10+ years of experience in software development or project management          Good communication skills with fluency in English language          Demonstrate Passion & Initiative, Relationship Cultivator and Quality Orientation              Job Overview: 1-5 years of experience            We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Scrum Master with a focus on E-commerce, PIM, CMS, GTM, and DS to join our team. As a Scrum Master, you will work closely with the development team and stakeholders to deliver high-quality products that meet business objectives using Agile methodologies.            Responsibilities:              Coach the development team and stakeholders on Agile principles, values, and practices          Facilitate Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives          Collaborate with the Product Owner to define and prioritize the product backlog          Manage and remove any impediments that are blocking the teams progress          Help the team to continuously improve their performance and optimize their processes          Communicate progress and status to stakeholders and leadership                        Requirements:              Strong understanding of Agile methodologies, frameworks, and practices          Familiarity with E-commerce, PIM, CMS, GTM, and DS          Excellent communication, facilitation, and leadership skills          Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams          Passion for learning and continuous improvement              Qualifications:              Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field          Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalent Agile certification preferred          1-5 years of experience in software development or project management          Good communication skills with fluency in English language          Demonstrate Passion & Initiative, Relationship Cultivator and Quality Orientation

column2: The Scrum Master is a servant leader who enables teams to self-organize, self-manage, and deliver via effective Lean-Agile practices. The Scrum Master supports ScrumXP, Kanban, and other ways of working the team have adopted. The Scrum Master also helps the team coordinate with other teams on the Agile Release Train (ART).            Responsibilities               Coach team members in Agile framework              Facilitates the team s progress toward team goals.              Manage sprint s scope and timeline              Facilitates team events, including the daily stand-up, iteration planning, iteration review, iteration retrospective.              Drives the removal of impediments to improve the likelihood of achieving the iteration objectives                  Facilitates planning, preparation and readiness for the sprint and program iteration. Leveraging tools, such as Jira, to facilitate planning.              Builds a high-performing team. Help build a productive environment where team members own the product and enjoy working on it.              Leads the team efforts in relentless improvement. Improve performance in the areas of quality, predictability, flow, and velocity. They help the team focus on creating increments of value each iteration and achieving daily and Iteration Goals in the context of the current Program Increment (PI) Objectives.              Implements quality assurance practices that ensure deliverables are up to quality standards at the end of each sprint              Development of performance metrics that track the team s progress on outcomes, flow, quality, and competency                  Supports the Product Owner (proxy Product Owner) in their efforts to manage the backlog and guide the team when facilitating a healthy team dynamic with respects to priorities and scope.              Supports estimating Guides the team in establishing normalized estimates and helps the team understand how to estimate features and stories.              Coordinate inter-team cooperation and helps the team operate well across the program.              Requirements             2-5 years experience in a scrum master role      Proven leadership experience      Strong technical acumen and experience with software development      Strong business acumen in the Financial Services or Insurance domain, with executive presence in a highly visible, client facing and consultative role.      Excellent knowledge of Scrum techniques and artifacts (such as definition of done, user stories, automated testing, backlog refinement)      Good knowledge of other Agile frameworks (Crystal, XP etc.)      Excellent communication, problem-solving and decision-making skills.      Outstanding organizational skills      Degree in Computer Science, Business, or similar field      Scrum master certification is a plus

column2: Responsibilities Guiding the team and organization on how to use Agile/Scrum practices and values to delight customers Guiding the team on self-organization to fill in the intentional gaps left in the Agile/Scrum frameworks Enabling team to be more cross functional Conducting Scrum Ceremonies, Guiding the team in estimation and getting clarifications from PO, working with PO on regular basis  Assessing the Scrum Maturity of the team and organization and coaching the team to higher levels of maturity, at a pace that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organization. Removing impediments or guiding the team to remove impediments by finding the right personnel to remove the impediment. Tracking Agile Metrics as part of Sprint Cycle and reporting. Scrum Training Sessions for the unit/groups. Technical and Professional Requirements: Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency. Knowledge and experience in handling various well-documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach (example: numerous Burndown technologies, various Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc.) Knowledge and experience in implementing technical engineering practices (Code Refactoring, Addressing and preventing Technical Debts, TDD etc) in projects Professional scrum master certification like CSM/PSM/SAFe RTE/SAFe Scrum Master are preferable Knowledge of other Agile approaches: XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD, etc. Awareness and experience with widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games.  Preferred Skills: Foundational->Development Methodology->Scrum  Educational Requirements MTech,MSc,MCA,BCA,BSc,BTech,Bachelor of Engineering  Service Line Application Development and Maintenance *  Location of posting is subject to business requirements

column2: DevOps Engineer with experience in developing, automating and debugging digital CI/CD pipelines with help of verity of automation tools and technology on Public Cloud.       key responsibilities       This position will be responsible to consult with clients and propose architectural solutions to help move improve infra from on-premise to cloud or help optimize cloud spend from one public cloud to the other.       Be the first one to experiment on new age cloud offerings, help define the best practise as a thought leader for cloud, automation Dev-Ops, be a solution visionary and technology expert across multiple channels         Continually augment skills and learn new tech as the technology and client needs evolve         Use your experience in Google cloud platform, AWS or Microsoft Azure to build hybrid-cloud solutions for customers         Provide leadership to project teams, and facilitates the definition of project deliverables around core Cloud based technology and methods         Define tracking mechanisms and ensure IT standards and methodology are met; deliver quality results         Participate in technical reviews of requirements, designs, code and other artifacts         Identify and keep abreast of new technical concepts in google cloud platform         Security, Risk and Compliance - Advise customers on best practices around access management, network setup, regulatory compliance and related areas         preferred qualifications       ?       Is Education overratedYes. We believe so. However there is no way to locate you otherwise. So unfortunately we might have to look for the Bachelors or Masters degree in engineering from a reputed institute or you should be programming from 12. And the latter is better. We will find you faster if you specify the latter in some manner. Not just degree, but we are not too thrilled by tech certifications too ... :)         To reiterate: Passion to tech-awesome, insatiable desire to learn the latest of the new-age cloud tech, highly analytical aptitude and a strong desire to deliver outlives those fancy degrees!         5 - 10 years of experience with at least 2 - 3 years of hands-on experience in Cloud Computing (AWS/GCP/Azure) and IT operational experience in a global enterprise environment         Good analytical, communication, problem solving, and learning skills         Knowledge on programming against cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform and lean development methodologies

column2: In this key role, you ll support a set of environments used by a platform s applications and assist as a point of contact for environment related activities      We ll look to you to assist environment managers in preparing a rolling environmental strategy which considers risks in relation to stability and resilience      You ll be joining a collaborative and supportive team, and have the opportunity to work with a range of stakeholders across the bank        Were offering this role at associate vice president level        What youll do          We re looking for an Environment Analyst to enable the successful implementation of platform change and deliver customer value by assisting environment managers to deliver complex and critical environment related activities      You ll help create stories and features for the domain backlog to enable a continual progression of changes and look for ways to improve efficiency, resilience, reliability, quality and manual inconsistency by increasing the use of automation and virtualisation            Your responsibilities will also include:            Supporting environment managers in managing a set of non-production environments and maintaining non-production environment dashboards      Understanding and maintaining a focus on customer value and providing a positive customer experience      Continually looking for ways to increase speed, efficiency, quality, resilience and reliability by introducing automated and virtualised environments      Working with environment managers to understand the upcoming flow of work and the customer vision in order to contribute to a fast response to environment related needs      Working with a range of stakeholders across the bank and third party suppliers to make sure that platform environments are optimised          The skills youll need          We re looking for a capable communicator, with knowledge of scaled Agile and Prince 2 tools and methodologies spanning value stream, portfolio, platform and feature team levels      You ll also need technical knowledge, including platform, technology, products and domains and experience in multiple languages or technical domains            We ll also expect:            An understanding of relevant industry standard environment toolsets and processes      Previous exposure to virtualisation and cloud adoption models      A good understanding of Agile methodologies and tools such as LeanKit, Scrum and Jira      The ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to colleagues, including management level      Good collaboration and stakeholder management skills
column11: Automation, Senior Analyst, Associate Vice President, Banking, Agile, Scrum, JIRA, Stakeholder management, Virtualization, Prince2

column2: As a Scrum Master (SM) you will play a key role of Team Coach. Tech (Any Discipline) degree from a recognized University / Institution. You have relevant experience with the development of high-tech solutions and a natural interest in mechatronic systems, preferably on embedded or PLC based control systems, mainly deployed for operating material handling automation solutions.       Minimum 12-15 years of relevant industry experience, out of which at least 4 years as a Scrum Master role. column2: Responsible for the health, safety and welfare of all personnel working on the vessel, for the protection of the environment and for ensuring that the McDermott HSES Policies are understood and implemented.      Responsible for working with the OCM / Superintendent on construction matters to ensure compliance with McDermott Clients requirements and expectations and promote general safety and harmony aboard the vessels.     This role will be working in offshore vessel.       Essential Qualifications and Education:         540 Days Sea Time as Chief Mate on vessels engaged in offshore construction operations.     Nautical Institute DP Operator s Certificate (for DP Vessels)      STCW95 Reg:      II/2 - Master      VI/I Basic Training      VI/2 Survival Craft and Rescue Boats other than FRB      VI/3 Advanced Fire Fighting      VI/5 - Ship Security Officer      II/1 - Generic and Type-Specific ECDIS training (for vessels with ECDIS) Valid Medical Certificate of Fitness      Navigational Mate Certificate of Competency attained through experience (accrued sea time) and formal education resulting in a Bachelor of Nautical Sciences (or equivalent) issued by an approved and recognized institution.          Key Tasks and Responsibilities:         Implementing the safety and environmental-protection policy of the Company      Motivating the crew in the observation of that policy      Issuing appropriate orders and instructions in a clear and simple manner      Verifying that specified requirements are observed.      Periodic auditing and verification of vessel documentation completed by subordinates. This includes but is not limited to HSEQ documentation and operational documentation related to DP operations (i.e., checklists etc.)      Reviewing the safety management system and reporting its deficiencies to the shore-based management      The Master is the manager and the Company s representative on the vessel.      Ultimately responsible for the safe operation of the vessel and the safety of lives onboard and the marine environment      Responsible for compliance with all safety regulations, Flag State, coastal state, and other applicable rules and legislation.     Responsible for all marine operations, safety of the crew and vessel      Responsible for overall hygiene quality control of the vessel      Responsible for maintaining order and discipline.      Responsible for the co-ordination of vessel movements, including navigation, DP, anchoring and auxiliary vessel activities (such as supply vessels, anchor handling tugs or other vessel movements)      Responsible through delegation for vessel communications, warehousing, medical facilities, catering, hotel activities and vessel housekeeping activities.      Responsible for the seaworthiness and /or stability of the vessel. In the event of an emergency endangering the seaworthiness or stability of the vessel or risk of death or serious injury, the Master has the authority to take whatever measures deemed necessary to remedy the situation.      Responsible through delegation to all other crew members or other related sub-contractors for the safe and efficient operation of the vessel      Responsible for efficiently managing the ship s crew and subcontractors, resulting in the general up-keep and maintenance of the vessel and its equipment.      Responsible for maintaining both Company and Client administrative documentation, emergency procedures, written instructions, and the vessel Safety Management System      Responsible for preparation and/or submission of logbooks, daily records, maintenance records and permits in accordance with Company and regulatory requirements.      Responsible for the investigation of any marine related incident and the implementation of any corrective action      Responsible for regular master s Review of the Safety Management System (SMS) Responsible for planning and conducting safety and emergency drills.      Responsible for ensuring the implementation of the company s environmental protection policy.      Responsible to ensure that the ISPS Code Ship Security Plan is implemented.      Ensure that all personnel familiarize themselves with those parts of the SMS that are applicable to their function.      To be familiar with, and capable of operating the vessel s GMDSS equipment      If the Master uses his authority to deviate from Company Procedures, the Master shall as soon as practicable, report in writing to management ashore the specific deviation and the reason for it. This shall include use of the Company Management of Change (MOC) process as relevant.      To be familiar with all Company procedures, including the Safety Management System, applicable to his duties      Responsible for refusing unsafe work and for carrying out all work in accordance with the established safety standards and work practices and reinforcing all crew members responsibility and right to refuse and stop unsafe work.      Taking part in emergency and occupational onboard training such as, the use of self-contained breathing apparatus, firefighting, man overboard exercises, lifeboat launching, security drills and other training as applicable for the function.      Wearing, inspecting, and caring for required personal protective equipment (PPE).     The Master or his/her delegate is responsible to access all on-signing seafarer s profile in MAPS and compare the present MAPS content to the originals presented at sign on. Any discrepancies or gaps (i.e., old / expired, or missing documents) must be reported to the Vessel Manager.

column2: Scrum Master takes on various roles based on the maturity level of the Agile team. Clearly, the success of any Agile team is based on the effective partnership of the Scrum Master and the team, collaborating, and embracing Agile principles. As a Scrum Master, you naturally have a servant leader and coach mindset. You will identify needs, remove impediments, and contribute as necessary to ensure the performance and success of the team. This position requires a leader accountable for maximizing the business value produced by the team, including throughput and delivery.        Responsibilities:            Lead multiple global cross-functional teams    on various projects by using Agile methodology (Scrum, Kanban, and SAFe).        Sprint Events:    Effectively manage and facilitate sprint ceremonies to support development and product releases.        Product Shaping/Scope Management:    Support the product owner and provide education where needed especially in Product Backlog health, Dependency Management to better manage Releases.        Stakeholder Management:    Partner, collaborate, and manage team stakeholders, vendors, and dependent teams.        PI and Sprint Planning:    Help the teams to accomplish Sprint goals & PI OKRs by following ceremonies and planning/estimation of epics in Agile tools. Lead planning increment sessions to establish scope and build release plans.        Coaching Teams:    Coach squads in self-organization. Help the squads achieve higher levels of Agile maturity.        Impediment Management:    Tactically identify dependencies and blockers, track and help remove them accordingly.        Retrospective:    Ability to identify pain points for Agile teams and bring in fresh practical ideas.        Progress tracking and Metrics:    Setup and review metrics to drive progress. Note anti-agile patterns through metrics and coach/steer teams accordingly. Escalate if progress is hindered.          Bachelors degree or higher from an accredited college/university.      4+ years of experience in building data platforms and solutions.      5+ years leading large-scale transformation programs (leveraging Agile or Scaled Agile Fra
column11: Business process, Health insurance, Agile, Scrum, Agile methodology, Scope management, Management, Stakeholder management, Internship, Team building

column2: BRIEF ROLE SUMMARY       Relationship Developers are a part of the Relationship Management team.      The relationship managers are passionate about our client s success and keep them informed and engaged in the Global Ed journey.     The role involves proactive engagement with the clients and helping them make the right decisions by moving them through the Global Ed journey efficiently, leveraging the cutting-edge platforms that we have deployed for students and the internal team.     This role is designed for ambitious and purpose driven individuals who love engaging with people and strive for personal & professional growth.       ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES       Understanding Student Context           Assessing student goals and objectives, competencies, academic credentials, experience and future vision through using internal tools              Understand updated information on higher education, career opportunities and industry dynamics to drive best outcomes for students           Driving the Global Ed Journey for Students           Work closely with students to help them navigate through the Global Ed journey via our proprietary industry-leading platform             Formulating/validating recommendations for our students backed by data and research              Facilitate dialogue between students and Universities for effective closing           Relationship Building         Proactively engaging with students (via platform, calls and other tools) and keeping them abreast of changes in their journey         Keep the students engaged throughout their association with us by inviting them to various events organized by TC Global to facilitate discussions.         Facilitate administrative requirements throughout the student journey, e.g. application, visa         Revenue Generation         Work with eligible students to pitch and close the relevant service offerings (learning programs, premium relationship management, psychometric assessment etc)       WHAT WE OFFER       A strong sense of purpose with the ability to impact lives of students by helping them make the right decisions for their future         An adaptive and fast-moving meritocracy driven environment         Exciting work environment that is adopting technology in a big way and operating on start-up ethos despite being of 25 years old         The ability to grow your role in an individual or leadership capacity driven by performance & demonstrated ability instead of time         A non-hierarchical culture where every member can reach out to the leadership team directly         Ability to learn about the higher education systems across the globe and the key careers that students pursue         Flexibility in working location with a remote-first work infrastructure       WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR       Education         Post graduation in any discipline is preferred but not essential         Global education and/or exposure is strongly preferred         Work Experience         2-5 years experience in relationship management or similar roles in Global Ed, Financial Services, Hospitality etc         Desire Attributes         Ambitious and purpose driven seeking personal and professional growth         Loves interacting with people         Passionate and curious with attention to detail         Ability and desire to meet and beat the assigned targets         Adaptable to change         Solution centric who take initiative to resolve student queries
column11: Relationship management, Hospitality, French, Claims, Publishing, Financial reporting, Customer support, Scheduling, Technical support, Financial services

column2: Job Description Roles and Responsibilities: In this role, you will: The Scrum Master is responsible for ensuring the scrum team's adherence to Agile / SAFe principles, keeping the team committed and completely focused to the sprint plan, and, continuously strive to maintain/improve the team velocity. Keeps the team engaged and committed and drives a sense of urgency in them. Continuously identifies and implements measurable improvements to team velocity Shields the team from external interference and distractions to keep the team focused on the sprint deliverables and helps resolve impediments. Facilitates PI planning, grooming, daily scrum stand-up meetings, retrospectives, sprint reviews, and planning sessions. Maintains the teams burn down chart and other related metrics (HCDD). Understand MR clinical needs and translate those to viable product features and requirements. Facilitate the use of latest tools, IDE, techniques and development environments that enhance team productivity, share best practices with other software engineering groups within GE Healthcare. Support the overall Host roadmap. Conform to established roadmaps and influence platform directions Act as the change agent for the team and continuously improve both platform and processes working with the leadership team. Foster collaboration with global engineering teams, business leadership team, cross functional teams and partner teams Focuses on ever-improving team dynamics and performance. Helps the team manage interpersonal conflicts, challenges, and opportunities for growth. Escalates people problems to management where necessary, but only after internal team processes have failed to resolve the issue; helps individuals and teams through personnel changes. Exhibits the behaviors of a Lean-Agile Leader with a Lean-Agile Mindset. Helps the team embrace SAFe Core Values, adopt and apply SAFe Principles, and implement SAFe practices. Educational Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering with minimum 8 years of software design & development experience working with cross-functional teams in an industry environment. Required Skills: 2+ years experience in working in Agile / SAFe software development teams as scrum master Demonstrate proficiency in core Java and C++ programming in a Linux environment with very good understanding of data structures. Experience in all aspects of Software Development Life Cycle in an industry environment. Demonstrated understanding/experience with the New Product Introduction (NPI) cycle Strong Analytical, debugging and Problem Solving skills. Proven skills in leading innovation from high-level definition and design through incremental evolution strategies Familiarity with healthcare industry software development practices, tools and environments including practical usage of Configuration Management systems, Defect Tracking tools and Debuggers. Ability to take ownership of tasks and deliver without supervision while using their discretion to seek help when necessary Good to have: Masters Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related computer field Creative problem solver and solution developer when presented with conflicting requirements, business demands and technical risks/issues Knowledge of GE Healthcare engineering tools and processes (PRD, QMS) Attention to detail and ability work independently toward timely completion of a variety of assignments Ability to develop unique concepts/solutions for complex products Strong verbal/written communication and influencing skills Experience working in a global team environment and a cross-functional product development environment. Willing to learn new technologies and flexible with roles and responsibilities Experience in modern software development including: microservices, full-stack development, dev ops, containerizing etc. Hands-on experience in developing RESTful services and Spring Framework Experience in SOA, OSGI, NodeJS, Junit, HTML5, Angular JS and Python

You will serve as a team coach, build high performing and self-sustaining teams while growing a healthy, collaborative, and continuously improving engineering culture. Your primary responsibilities include facilitating the learning and growth of one or more Agile teams, developing a lean-Agile mindset, improving practices and guiding teams to more predictable delivery. Day-to-day responsibilities include leading Scrum events (backlog, planning, review, retrospectives, daily stand ups and representing the Scrum team(s) in weekly syncs. column2: Scrum Master Are you a passionate Agile leader who thrives in fast-paced environments? Do you have a proven track record of coaching teams and driving efficiency? If so, we want to hear from you! We seek a highly motivated Agile Program Manager to join our growing team. In this role, you will lead and coach two agile teams while overseeing program execution. You will collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to plan and deliver value predictably, ensuring alignment with strategic goals. Responsibilities: Schedule and lead PI Planning events for scrum teams. Facilitate collaborative, cadenced planning for quarterly program increments. Continuously improve processes, team structures, and tools to optimize team efficiency. Identify trends impacting delivery predictability and develop improvement initiatives. Track program metrics and share insights to demonstrate progress and execution. Foster close collaboration with Product Managers, Delivery Leaders, and Architects to achieve program milestones. Coach teams on Agile best practices to enhance predictability. Lead and facilitate agile ceremonies like sprint planning, daily stand-ups, reviews, and retrospectives. Develop and maintain internal training materials and documentation to ensure adherence to standard operating procedures. Monitor dependencies and risks, proactively resolving issues or escalating to maintain workflow. Manage Jira sprints and configurations to optimize workflow and streamline processes. Leverage Agile principles and data to contribute to informed decision-making in leadership discussions. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent 4+ years of experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies (SAFe certification a plus) Experience implementing enterprise-level software applications Proven experience leading engineering teams Experience in the Scrum Master role for 3-4 years (software development preferred) Desired Skills: SAFe Scrum Master certification Proficiency in Agile management tools (Confluence, Jira) Strong servant leadership, facilitation, and communication skills Expertise in conflict resolution, continual improvement, and team empowerment Deep understanding of incremental delivery and the value of metrics Familiarity with backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition We offer a competitive compensation package and a chance to work on cutting-edge technologies in a collaborative and fast-paced environment. If you're ready to take your Agile expertise to the next level, apply today!

column2: We are looking for a Scrum Master to coordinate and coach our software development team as a go-to person for applying scrum to produce high-quality work. The person needs to be based in one of our offices in India - either Calicut or Trivandrum.        Key responsibilities:       Key responsibilities: Manage each project s scope and timeline    Coordinate sprints, retrospective meetings and daily stand-ups    Coach team members in Agile frameworks    Facilitate internal communication and effective collaboration    Be the point of contact for external communications (e.g. from customers or stakeholders)    Work with product owners to handle backlogs and new requests    Resolve conflicts and remove obstacles that occur    Help teams implement changes effectively    Ensure deliverables are up to quality standards at the end of each sprint    Guide development teams to higher scrum maturity    Help build a productive environment where team members own the product and enjoy working on it        ?       Requirements (Qualifications / Experience / Competencies)       ?     Experience in a scrum master role    Familiarity with software development    Excellent knowledge of Scrum techniques and artifacts (such as definition of done, user stories, automated testing, backlog refinement)    Good knowledge of other Agile frameworks (Crystal, XP etc.)    Excellent communication and servant leadership skills    Problem-solving and conflict-resolution ability    Outstanding organizational skills    Degree in Computer Science, Business or similar field    Scrum master certification is a plus

column2: Responsible for the health, safety and welfare of all personnel working on the vessel, for the protection of the environment and for ensuring that the McDermott HSES Policies are understood and implemented.      Responsible for working with the OCM / Superintendent on construction matters to ensure compliance with McDermott Clients requirements and expectations and promote general safety and harmony aboard the vessels.     This role will be working in offshore vessel.       Essential Qualifications and Education:         540 Days Sea Time as Chief Mate on vessels engaged in offshore construction operations.     Nautical Institute DP Operator s Certificate (for DP Vessels)      STCW95 Reg:      II/2 - Master      VI/I Basic Training      VI/2 Survival Craft and Rescue Boats other than FRB      VI/3 Advanced Fire Fighting      VI/5 - Ship Security Officer      II/1 - Generic and Type-Specific ECDIS training (for vessels with ECDIS) Valid Medical Certificate of Fitness      Navigational Mate Certificate of Competency attained through experience (accrued sea time) and formal education resulting in a Bachelor of Nautical Sciences (or equivalent) issued by an approved and recognized institution.          Key Tasks and Responsibilities:         Implementing the safety and environmental-protection policy of the Company      Motivating the crew in the observation of that policy      Issuing appropriate orders and instructions in a clear and simple manner      Verifying that specified requirements are observed.      Periodic auditing and verification of vessel documentation completed by subordinates. This includes but is not limited to HSEQ documentation and operational documentation related to DP operations (i.e., checklists etc.)      Reviewing the safety management system and reporting its deficiencies to the shore-based management      The Master is the manager and the Company s representative on the vessel.      Ultimately responsible for the safe operation of the vessel and the safety of lives onboard and the marine environment      Responsible for compliance with all safety regulations, Flag State, coastal state, and other applicable rules and legislation.     Responsible for all marine operations, safety of the crew and vessel      Responsible for overall hygiene quality control of the vessel      Responsible for maintaining order and discipline.      Responsible for the co-ordination of vessel movements, including navigation, DP, anchoring and auxiliary vessel activities (such as supply vessels, anchor handling tugs or other vessel movements)      Responsible through delegation for vessel communications, warehousing, medical facilities, catering, hotel activities and vessel housekeeping activities.      Responsible for the seaworthiness and /or stability of the vessel. In the event of an emergency endangering the seaworthiness or stability of the vessel or risk of death or serious injury, the Master has the authority to take whatever measures deemed necessary to remedy the situation.      Responsible through delegation to all other crew members or other related sub-contractors for the safe and efficient operation of the vessel      Responsible for efficiently managing the ship s crew and subcontractors, resulting in the general up-keep and maintenance of the vessel and its equipment.      Responsible for maintaining both Company and Client administrative documentation, emergency procedures, written instructions, and the vessel Safety Management System      Responsible for preparation and/or submission of logbooks, daily records, maintenance records and permits in accordance with Company and regulatory requirements.      Responsible for the investigation of any marine related incident and the implementation of any corrective action      Responsible for regular master s Review of the Safety Management System (SMS) Responsible for planning and conducting safety and emergency drills.      Responsible for ensuring the implementation of the company s environmental protection policy.      Responsible to ensure that the ISPS Code Ship Security Plan is implemented.      Ensure that all personnel familiarize themselves with those parts of the SMS that are applicable to their function.      To be familiar with, and capable of operating the vessel s GMDSS equipment      If the Master uses his authority to deviate from Company Procedures, the Master shall as soon as practicable, report in writing to management ashore the specific deviation and the reason for it. This shall include use of the Company Management of Change (MOC) process as relevant.      To be familiar with all Company procedures, including the Safety Management System, applicable to his duties      Responsible for refusing unsafe work and for carrying out all work in accordance with the established safety standards and work practices and reinforcing all crew members responsibility and right to refuse and stop unsafe work.      Taking part in emergency and occupational onboard training such as, the use of self-contained breathing apparatus, firefighting, man overboard exercises, lifeboat launching, security drills and other training as applicable for the function.      Wearing, inspecting, and caring for required personal protective equipment (PPE).     The Master or his/her delegate is responsible to access all on-signing seafarer s profile in MAPS and compare the present MAPS content to the originals presented at sign on. Any discrepancies or gaps (i.e., old / expired, or missing documents) must be reported to the Vessel Manager.

column2: Description - If you are customer centric mindset, well-versed Agile practitioner who can act as a plug& play consultant in a mature corporate environment and want to play a crucial role in HPs Digital Transformation leading an AI/ML based Release Train, then this is the role for you. MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES: Facilitate and Lead Solution Train: PI planning events for multiple ARTs, ensure alignment of ARTs within the organizations goals and objectives. Fosters a Lean-Agile mindset and principles across the Solution Train. Supports Agile practices and principles to drive delivery excellence. Ensures strategic alignment and decision making: Collaborates with Portfolio stakeholders to ensure alignment of the Solution Train's work with strategic initiatives and customer needs. Work with Product Management to prioritize features and ensure they align with business priorities. Coordinate Multiple ARTs to deliver complex solutions that may span different organizational units or value streams. Identify and resolve dependencies, risks, and impediments across ARTs Drives proper Communication within the Release Train and to executive Sponsors: Communicate progress, challenges, and dependencies to leadership, stakeholders, and teams, Maintain visibility into the status of all ARTs and provide regular reporting on Solution Train performance. Supports continuous improvement, Identifies opportunities to enhance efficiency, quality, and value delivery. Leads efforts to utilize Agile and works with teams and organizations to help them adopt the appropriate methodologies, practices, and principles. This may include introducing Agile concepts, facilitating Agile ceremonies, and coaching teams on Agile best practices. Propagates Agile mindset for all levels: from team to executives. Facilitates Agile delivery, works closely with teams to help them improve their Agile practices, facilitate problem-solving, and guide them through the Agile process. Provides guidance on how to develop and maintain Agile artifacts such as product backlogs, user stories, and sprint backlogs. Provides Agile training to teams, stakeholders, and leadership on Agile concepts, practices, and principles. Performs Agile maturity assessments and creates action plans for various groups / organizations needing Agile coaching. Measures and tracks progress using Agile metrics such as velocity, burn-down charts, and cycle time. They will use this information to help teams identify areas for improvement and adjust their processes accordingly. Manages vendor identification and selection process when a vendor is required Stays up-to-date with emerging trends and best practices in Agile methodologies, and make recommendations on how to incorporate them into the organization's Agile practices. JOB REQUIREMENTS: SAFe Expertise:  Extensive knowledge and experience with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and its principles, including SAFe certifications like SAFe Program Consultant (SPC) or equivalent. Minimum 3 years experience. Agile Experience : Strong background in Agile methodologies, including Scrum and Kanban, with experience in facilitating Agile ceremonies and coaching Agile teams. Minimum 10 years experience. Leadership Skills : Effective leadership and facilitation skills to lead large groups of individuals, foster collaboration, and resolve conflicts. Communication : Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact with teams, stakeholders, and leadership effectively, at all levels Problem-Solving : Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities to address complex issues and dependencies. Strategic Thinking : The ability to align the Solution Train's work with organizational strategy and objectives. Adaptability : Flexibility to adapt to changing circumstances, prioritize tasks, and handle ambiguity. Continuous Learning : Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with industry best practices and SAFe updates. Collaboration : A collaborative and servant leadership mindset, focused on helping teams achieve their goals. Technical Knowledge : Understanding of technology and the ability to engage in technical discussions, although not necessarily at a deep technical level. BA or BS degree - A bachelor's degree in a relevant field is often preferred, but experience and certifications may be considered in lieu of formal education. Mastery in English is a must KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS: Superior communication skills (i.e. written, verbal, presentation), leadership, consulting, influence, and negotiation skills. Ability to interact with all levels of the company top to bottom, including most senior company management. Excellent program management, problem solving, and analytical skills, and the ability to execute a value stream within the scope of overall strategies. Strong financial and business acumen and ability to link interactive plans and activities to business results. Tact and diplomacy Shift - No shift premium (Romania)

column2: The Scrum Master is a servant leader who enables teams to self-organize, self-manage, and deliver via effective Lean-Agile practices. The Scrum Master supports ScrumXP, Kanban, and other ways of working the team have adopted. The Scrum Master also helps the team coordinate with other teams on the Agile Release Train (ART).            Responsibilities               Coach team members in Agile framework              Facilitates the team s progress toward team goals.              Manage sprint s scope and timeline              Facilitates team events, including the daily stand-up, iteration planning, iteration review, iteration retrospective.              Drives the removal of impediments to improve the likelihood of achieving the iteration objectives                  Facilitates planning, preparation and readiness for the sprint and program iteration. Leveraging tools, such as Jira, to facilitate planning.              Builds a high-performing team. Help build a productive environment where team members own the product and enjoy working on it.              Leads the team efforts in relentless improvement. Improve performance in the areas of quality, predictability, flow, and velocity. They help the team focus on creating increments of value each iteration and achieving daily and Iteration Goals in the context of the current Program Increment (PI) Objectives.              Implements quality assurance practices that ensure deliverables are up to quality standards at the end of each sprint              Development of performance metrics that track the team s progress on outcomes, flow, quality, and competency                  Supports the Product Owner (proxy Product Owner) in their efforts to manage the backlog and guide the team when facilitating a healthy team dynamic with respects to priorities and scope.              Supports estimating Guides the team in establishing normalized estimates and helps the team understand how to estimate features and stories.              Coordinate inter-team cooperation and helps the team operate well across the program.              Requirements             2-5 years experience in a scrum master role      Proven leadership experience      Strong technical acumen and experience with software development      Strong business acumen in the Financial Services or Insurance domain, with executive presence in a highly visible, client facing and consultative role.      Excellent knowledge of Scrum techniques and artifacts (such as definition of done, user stories, automated testing, backlog refinement)      Good knowledge of other Agile frameworks (Crystal, XP etc.)      Excellent communication, problem-solving and decision-making skills.      Outstanding organizational skills      Degree in Computer Science, Business, or similar field      Scrum master certification is a plus
